intro: Serratula coronata subsp. coronata, commonly known as the crownhead fleabane, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It is a member of the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its yellow, daisy-like flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky soils. It has a basal rosette of leaves and a single, erect stem topped with a cluster of flowering heads. Serratula coronata subsp. coronata is often found in disturbed areas and is adapted to arid environments.
